column4: This equation values a stock as the present value of all future dividends growing at a constant rate
This model assumes high growth in the first stage and stable growth in the second stage
This advanced model includes three growth phases: high growth, transitional growth, and stable growth

column2: P/E = \frac{P}{EPS} = \frac{\text{Market Price per Share}}{\text{Earnings per Share}}
column4: This ratio shows how much investors are willing to pay per dollar of earnings

column2: P/B = \frac{P}{BVPS} = \frac{\text{Market Price per Share}}{\text{Book Value per Share}}
column4: This ratio compares market value to accounting value of shareholders' equity

column2: P/S = \frac{P}{SPS} = \frac{\text{Market Price per Share}}{\text{Sales per Share}}
column4: This ratio shows how much investors pay per dollar of revenue
This ratio measures enterprise value relative to earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization

column2: P/CF = \frac{P}{CFPS} = \frac{\text{Market Price per Share}}{\text{Cash Flow per Share}}
column4: This ratio compares stock price to operating cash flow generation
This ratio values the enterprise based on its ability to generate free cash flow
Beta measures systematic risk relative to the market, where Î² > 1 indicates higher volatility
This equation calculates beta through linear regression of stock returns against market returns
This formula adjusts historical beta toward 1.0 to account for mean reversion
This equation shows how debt increases equity beta due to financial leverage

column2: EPS = \frac{\text{Net Income} - \text{Preferred Dividends}}{\text{Weighted Average Shares Outstanding}}
column4: This metric shows earnings available to common shareholders per share
This represents the accounting value of equity per share
ROE measures how efficiently a company generates profits from shareholders' equity
This ratio adjusts P/E for growth expectations, where PEG < 1 may indicate undervaluation
This percentage shows annual dividend income relative to stock price
This ratio shows what portion of earnings is returned to shareholders as dividends
This ratio shows what portion of earnings is retained for growth and investment
This indicator calculates the average price over the last n periods
This weighted average gives more importance to recent prices
This momentum oscillator ranges from 0-100, with readings above 70 indicating overbought conditions
This momentum indicator shows the difference between fast and slow exponential moving averages
This is the 9-period EMA of the MACD line, used to generate trading signals
This shows the difference between MACD and signal line, indicating momentum changes
Upper Bollinger Band shows price levels 2 standard deviations above the 20-period moving average
Lower Bollinger Band shows price levels 2 standard deviations below the 20-period moving average
This measures volatility - wider bands indicate higher volatility
This shows where the current price sits relative to Bollinger Bands (0-1 range)</content>
